instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00850: What is 820-00850? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_G3H_RTC: What is PP3V3_G3H_RTC? PP3V3_G3H_RTC Is one of the first rails that has to come on in order for the USB-C mux chip to be powered in the T2 chip Macbook Pros..
definitions.PP3V3_UPC_TA_LDO: What is PP3V3_UPC_TA_LDO? PP3V3_UPC_TA_LDO is an LDO coming out of the CD3215 USB-C muxing chip. When this is missing, either a capacitor on the line has shorted, PP3V3_G3H is missing, or the CD3215 is bad..
definitions.CD3215: What is CD3215? This is a USB-C muxing chip responsible for USB-C communication with devices such as the laptop charger. The most common issue this chip is involved in is when a Macbook wonâ€™t charge or the charger is stuck at 5v instead of going to 20v..
definitions.PP5V_G3S: What is PP5V_G3S? PP5V_G3S is a 5v power rail present when the system is in a G3S standby state.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP1V1_LDO</SIGNAL> missing in two CD chips
threads.message:
Hi guys,
I'm working on a MB that came with a partial short an corrosion on CB300 and CB308 and had also a burned L8504.

Once CB300 & 308 were replace, <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H_RTC</SIGNAL> & <SIGNAL>PP3V3_UPC_TA_LDO</SIGNAL> came back but <SIGNAL>PP1V1_LDO</SIGNAL> is missing in UB300 & UB400 (<SIGNAL>PP1V8_LDO</SIGNAL> X2 are present)

Both CD chips (UB300/400) have been replace 3 times each from 2 different suppliers and im still missing <SIGNAL>PP1V1_LDO</SIGNAL> in both chips.
diode mode readings look good compered with <CHIP>U3100</CHIP> &  <CHIP>U3200</CHIP> which have all LDOs present.

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 12.34 V
PP20V  has 5V in all 4 ports

is there anything else besides the CD chips that can affect <SIGNAL>PP1V1_LDO</SIGNAL> lines?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP1V1_LDO</SIGNAL> missing in two CD chips
threads.message:
[URL unfurl="true"]https://logi.wiki/index.php/CD3215_Bootup_Sequence[/URL]
[QUOTE]The TBT ROM is required to get to 20V.  It is powered by the <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> on the opposite side.  It will not boot unless it can communicate.  It seems with liquid in that area, the trace between the LDO of the <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> and TBT ROM gets damaged at the test point. Without communication with the TBT ROM, the 1.1V BMC LDO (PIN 35) won't come up while other LDOs will be present. The 1.1V BMC LDO is used to drive the logic negotiating USB-PD (USB 2.0 communications to charger). When that happens, when USB-C is connected to this <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP>, it will not negotiate 20V and get stuck on 5V, not cycling.
[/QUOTE]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP1V1_LDO</SIGNAL> missing in two CD chips
threads.message:
Hi Piernov !

Thank you very much for this info.
I have replaced UB090 and i got back <SIGNAL>PP1V1_LDO</SIGNAL> in the master UB300 however <SIGNAL>PP1V1_LDO</SIGNAL> is still missing in UB400. So.. I have replaced UB400 again but still the same, no <SIGNAL>1V1_LDO</SIGNAL>.. (no shorts around )

what do you think?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP1V1_LDO</SIGNAL> missing in two CD chips
threads.message:
1V1 LDO only appears on the powered port.

Check UB400 surrounding resistors and traces.
UB300 boots from UB090, but UB400 boots from UB300, through UART lines.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP1V1_LDO</SIGNAL> missing in two CD chips
threads.message:
Hola 2informaticos ! 

Confirmed, I have checked <SIGNAL>1V1_LDO</SIGNAL> only in the powered port.

Resistors and traces are ok
<SIGNAL>UPC_TA_UART_TX</SIGNAL> & <SIGNAL>UPC_TA_UART_RX</SIGNAL> have 3.35 V (both ports UB300/400)

I found a little diference in diode mode readings in <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4_T_USBC</SIGNAL> 0.148 compared to <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4_X_USBC</SIGNAL> 0.203

what do you think?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP1V1_LDO</SIGNAL> missing in two CD chips
threads.message:
"<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 12.34 V"
Was this reading with charger alone (battery not connected)?
If yes, do you get this voltage on all 4 USB-C ports?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP1V1_LDO</SIGNAL> missing in two CD chips
threads.message:
yes, reading was using only the charger.

Right now, after the changes and using only the charger as well, I have in <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 12.29 steady in both ports ( UB300/400 ) but in the other two, where <SIGNAL>1V1_LDO</SIGNAL> shows up (<CHIP>U3100</CHIP>/200) is not steady.  It goes to 12.30 and then goes to 6.34 , 10.40 and then goes back to 12.30 and so on..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP1V1_LDO</SIGNAL> missing in two CD chips
threads.message: What is the USB-C input voltage behaviour on the 4 ports?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP1V1_LDO</SIGNAL> missing in two CD chips
threads.message:
In  <CHIP>U3100</CHIP>/200 goes 4.9 V then 0.0 V, 5.1 V and so on..
In  UB300/400  4.9 V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP1V1_LDO</SIGNAL> missing in two CD chips
threads.message:
Seems that board tries to turn on and cycles on <CHIP>U3100</CHIP>/200 side.
But still has problems on UB300/400.

Check with charger and battery connected at same time.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP1V1_LDO</SIGNAL> missing in two CD chips
threads.message:
With the battery and charger connected, the cycles continue in the <CHIP>U3100</CHIP>/200 side it goes 20, 18, 0, 5, 8, 20 V and so on...
in the other side (UB300/400) goes :
UB300 5V
UB400 0V (not shorted) I do have 3.<SIGNAL>3_LDO</SIGNAL> and X2 1.<SIGNAL>8_LDO</SIGNAL> but still missing 1.<SIGNAL>1_LDO</SIGNAL>

Could it be that I had a very bad luck with the CD chips im replacing in UB400? or something else ?
what do you think?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP1V1_LDO</SIGNAL> missing in two CD chips
threads.message: You can swap actual UB400 with working one; <CHIP>U3100</CHIP>/200, or UB300, depending which is more easy for you.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP1V1_LDO</SIGNAL> missing in two CD chips
threads.message:
I swapped UB400 with UB300.

Still same behavior... 
at least I know my CD chips are fine :) hahahaha

any ideas?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP1V1_LDO</SIGNAL> missing in two CD chips
threads.message: There must be corroded resistors, or traces...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP1V1_LDO</SIGNAL> missing in two CD chips
threads.message:
There are no corroded resistors or traces...

Could this be related to <SIGNAL>PP5V_G3S</SIGNAL>? L8504 was totally burned it even burned the pad...
I have 0.393 diode mode in that line...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP1V1_LDO</SIGNAL> missing in two CD chips
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>5V_G3S</SIGNAL> is a common thing for entire board.
How can affect one USB-C port only?

Just in case, keep J8500 disconnected, until get correct voltages on the MLB.

You've mentioned about corroded caps found on USB-C area.
You had UB090 affected; UB000 may be affected too.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP1V1_LDO</SIGNAL> missing in two CD chips
threads.message:
Yea, just what I thought.. just wanted to make sure I wasn't missing something with that <SIGNAL>5V_G3S</SIGNAL> line.


Unfortunately the client couldn't wait more.. so this one went out as No Fix..

Thank you very much anyways !
